note.p: Birth: Polgooth, near St Austell, Cornwall, England (18 February 1822)

Career: Apprenticed to a surveyor, but left to study metallurgy; returned to England (1848); worked as a metallurgist, London; Professor of Metallurgy, College for Civil Engineers, Putney (1848-1850); spent a year in California (1853); built and managed a metal works, Widnes; studied the microscopic structure of minerals and rocks
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1887-1888 vol 43 pp iii-iv signed by W W S
